definition: broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of

sentences.english: but not that good at other things, you know, they'll make an exception, so.
sentences.chinese: 但是别的不行，他们会破例，就这样。

sentences.english: Legendary novelette is an innovative and exceptional genre in the history of Chinese fiction.
sentences.chinese: 中篇传奇小说是中国小说发展史上的创举和破例。

sentences.english: An exception would not be made.
sentences.chinese: 就算是这样也不能破例。

sentences.english: Could you make an exception and accept D/A or D/P?
sentences.chinese: 你们能不能破例接受承兑交单或付款交单？

sentences.english: Exception was made only for the Roman Carmen, well-known author of pre-war documentaries.
sentences.chinese: 而唯一可以破例的是战前的著名作家，罗曼卡门。

sentences.english: Though always on a tight time budget, he asked me out of the blue to take a walk with him that night.
sentences.chinese: 当天晚上，一向惜时如金的他，破例邀我去散步。

sentences.english: But I’m making an exception because the issue is so important.
sentences.chinese: 但是我现在要破例，因为这个问题实在太重要了。

sentences.english: Normal credit terms are net 30, ex-works Dunedin although exceptions are made.
sentences.chinese: 正常地信贷前提是净30，出厂达尼丁固然是破例地。

sentences.english: Due to the stage performance, he made an exception to the lent me.
sentences.chinese: 因为要登台演奏，他才破例将胡琴借给了我。

sentences.english: Stop pestering me. I can't make an exception for you.
sentences.chinese: 别跟我泡蘑菇了，我们不能为你破例。

sentences.english: I made an exception this time because apparently Google is increasing the frequency of the updates.
sentences.chinese: 我这次破例了，因为谷歌显然增加了更新的频率。

sentences.english: I don't normally write about anniversaries, but this one seems worth noting.
sentences.chinese: 通常我不会撰写周年纪念文章，但为这件事破例。

definition: unprecedented/for the first time/never before/first ever
to break the rule/to make an exception
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
to tackle a difficult job (idiom)/to do sth reluctantly
lit. to eat one's words/to break a promise/to go back on one's word/to renege/unsworn testimony
to tactfully decline/to turn down gracefully
to show deference or praise publicly
to give a nod of approval
